titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Caryl Phillips Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday November 17, 2018 at 04:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Caryl Phillips Papers consists of correspondence, writings, research files, business papers, computer disks, audio recordings and printed material created and accumulated by Caryl Phillips from circa 1979 until 2006, including some research material with earlier dates. Writings include drafts (autograph manuscripts, typescripts, printouts, and computer files) and other material related to all of his major works during this time period, including the plays Strange Fruit (1981), Where There is Darkness (1982), and The Shelter (1984), and the novels The Final Passage (1985), A State of Independence (1986), Higher Ground (1989), Cambridge (1991), Crossing the River (1993), The Nature of Blood (1997), A Distant Shore (2003), and Dancing in the Dark (2005). Writings also include drafts and other material related to articles, lectures, and reviews. Correspondence is chiefly professional in nature, and relates to writings, publishing, and other professional activities.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Copies of electronic files are available through Access Services.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Co. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2000-2006.
February 2016 Acquisiton: purchased from Caryl Phillips on the James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection Fund.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 35-36 and 75-77: Restricted until 2050. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Boxes 37, 74, and 116 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 4, 5, 7, 12, 15-20, 72 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Caryl Phillips Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Caryl Phillips Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat MSS 15, Uncat MSS 895

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: February 2000 Acquisition, September 2006 Acquisition, and February 2016 Acquisition.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with or relates to material found in other acquisitions (e.g. correspondence and writings can be found in both groupings). In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers should consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Caryl Phillips Papers consists of correspondence, writings, research files, business papers, computer disks, audio recordings, and printed material created and accumulated by Caryl Phillips from circa 1979 until 2006. Writings include drafts (autograph manuscripts, typescripts, printouts, and computer files) and other material related to all of his major works during this time period, including the plays Strange Fruit (1981), Where There is Darkness (1982), The Shelter (1984), and the novels The Final Passage (1985), A State of Independence (1986), Higher Ground (1989), Cambridge (1991), Crossing the River (1993), The Nature of Blood (1997), A Distant Shore (2003), and Dancing in the Dark (2005). Writings also include drafts and other material related to articles, lectures, and reviews. Correspondence is chiefly professional in nature, and relates to writings, publishing, and other professional activities.

bioghist.head: Caryl Phillips (1958-)
bioghist.p: Caryl Phillips, born in 1958 in St. Kitts, is a British playwright, screenwriter, and novelist. He is a Professor of English at Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 35-36: Restricted until 2050. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Box 37: (computer disks): Original computer disks are restricted. Copies of electronic files are available through Access Services.
Audio cassettes in boxes 4, 5, 7, 12, 15-20: Use of original audio cassettes is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under five headings: Published Books by Phillips, Stage, Film and Radio Projects, Other Writings by Phillips, Reviews and Press Reports on Phillips' Work, and Correspondence and Business Records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The February 2000 Acquisition consists of writings, correspondence, and business records dating from 1979 to 1997. Material related to many, though not all, of Phillips' early writings can be found in this acquisition, including later drafts of Strange Fruit (1981), and drafts of Cambridge (1991), Crossing the River (1993), The Nature of Blood (1997). Correspondence is chiefly with publishers. Other material includes reviews and clippings related to Phillips' life and work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are grouped together according to title but are not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The September 2006 Acquisition consists of writings, research files, correspondence, business records, and audio recordings dating from 1940 to 2006, with the bulk of material dating from 1979 to 2006. Writings include early drafts of Strange Fruit (1981) and material for Celebration (1980) as well as later writings such as The Atlantic Sound (2000), Dancing in the Dark (2005), and the screen adaptation of Mystic Masseur (2001). Correspondence is chiefly with publishers or relates to lectures and professional travel. Other material includes reviews and clippings related to Phillips' life and work, and audio recordings relating to Phillips' research and work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized by type of correspondence, and further arranged chronologically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings: Novels, Playscripts and Screenplays, and Reviews and Interviews.
